meanings.definition: A member of a traditionally nomadic people living chiefly in Romania and Hungary.
meanings.sent1: The zingari traveled from place to place in search of new opportunities.
meanings.sent2: I met a group of zingari at the market selling handmade crafts.
meanings.sent3: The zingari decided to set up camp in the park for the night, much to the surprise of the locals.
meanings.sent4: Her free spirit and wanderlust made her feel like a zingari in her own town.
meanings.sent5: The colorful wagons of the zingari brightened up the dull landscape.

meanings.definition: The language of the Romani people, also known as Romany.
meanings.sent1: She learned to speak zingari fluently after spending time with the Romani community.
meanings.sent2: The zingari language is rich in history and culture.
meanings.sent3: Trying to mimic the zingari language sounded like a fun challenge for the children.
meanings.sent4: The words in zingari flowed like music to her ears.
meanings.sent5: Listening to the elders speak in zingari was like hearing a beautiful melody.
